description.narrative: Funding under this activity supports Department of Water, Environment and Natural Resources (DEWNR) to supply water monitoring field equipment to the Solomon Islands Ministry of Mines, Energy and Rural Electrification for the purpose of improving the Solomon Island Governments’ capacity to consistently monitor their key water systems, enabling informed water management into the future. The equipment equates to more than 15 permanent monitoring sites, as well as transportable monitoring apparatus. The Solomon Islands has a small population of about 600,000 and water management is a big issue because the majority of water use is for critical human needs. Approximately 19% of people do not have access to safe water and with only 23% of the population having access to electricity, the country is exploring hydro-electrical power options. Therefore, water monitoring data is instrumental for good water management.
